column4: i need help getting pulseaudio to work: my computer currently has no sound. desktop ubuntu 11.04, 00:14.2 Audio device: ATI Technologies Inc SBx00 Azalia (Intel HDA) - Sound Preferences Hardware is set to Analog Stereo Duplex. i was messing with that, trying to get it not to sound like glass smashing on foil, and it quit working.
for my next death defying trick i get to take apart the washing machine. can someone help with ubuntu sound?
type 'alsamixer' in a console and see what is muted
it looks like maybe <Headphone> is - and that's the plug i have my speakers in?
but it does talk when i do speaker test in the terminal.
if headphones is muted and that's where you expect sound to come out, you should unmute the headphones
i don't see how to do that?
in alsamixer, move left/right until you've highlighted the right one, then hit 'm' to mute or unmute
doesn't change the color - it's the only one that isn't green/white/red with blue at the bottom.
it should change the bottom part. It should change between 'm' and something else every time you hit 'm'
that's a bit weird, I dunno.
I don't really know what pulse does to things, perhaps that's part of the issue.
yeah.. i updatead the drivers because of the crunching
i turned things off and on again in the gui stuff
you can choose any window borders you'd like, and revert easily.

Well, you're going to install a window border theme. In the same app that you use to switch themes (I forget the exact name, as I use xubuntu), there will be several options. One of them is the default. You can try them out right now if you'd like.
it's going to be in 'appearances' or 'window borders'
